bibl.title: Letter from Willard L. Beaulac to Philip Showalter Hench, February 6, 1953

div1.p: Beaulac writes that the Embassy and the U.S. government should be grateful to Hench for all that he has done.

div1.head: Letter from Willard L. Beaulac to Philip Showalter Hench, February 6, 1953
div1.opener:
THE FOREIGN SERVICE
OF THE
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
Habana, February 6, 1953
ADDRESS OFFICIAL COMMUNICATIONS TO
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
The Department has sent us copies of your
extraordinarily nice letter to the Secretary of
State concerning the cooperation of the Embassy
in connection with the Camp Lazear ceremonies.
It is really the Embassy, and our Government,
that should be grateful to you for all that you
did with such enthusiasm and without obligation.
Again I should like to tell you how helpful you
have been to us in Cuba.

With renewed appreciation and with kindest
personal regards,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Willard Beaulac Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
